title: Strengthening Systems Design Practice Competency: eLearning Intensive Course for Nuclear Medicine Image Interpretation for Non-Medical Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and fundamental radiology concepts
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish between normal and abnormal patterns in radioactive isotope bone scan images with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can apply 15 or more internationally standardized nuclear medicine imaging terms contextually during image interpretation.
Learners can perform a three-stage interpretation protocol (initial reading, suspicious area verification, conclusion derivation) with over 90% accuracy based on real clinical cases.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
